entry.title: compositions by Graham Waterhouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that compositions by Graham Waterhouse (pictured) range from the beginning of his String Sextet, Op. 1, in 1979 to the Fantasia Ucraina for two violins in 2022?

entry.title: Clara MacBeth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Clara MacBeth lived on a cruise ship for over a decade?

entry.title: Oh My God, Charlie Darwin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Oh My God, Charlie Darwin was recorded by the Low Anthem in ten days in a Block Island basement?

entry.title: run-pass option (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that run-pass option plays used in college football allow quarterbacks to pass the ball farther downfield than those used in the NFL?

entry.title: Josef Somr (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite having roles in more than 170 films, Josef Somr preferred acting in theatre?

entry.title: Bowery Savings Bank Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when the Bowery Savings Bank Building opened in 1895, "the bank as a work of architecture went from the merely big to the colossal"?

entry.title: Zail Singh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Zail Singh was the first Sikh and the first person from a backward caste to become President of India?

entry.title: Iowa Cow War (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Iowa Cow War started due to bovine tuberculosis testing?
